name: proxify
description: Portable proxy for capturing, manipulating, and replaying HTTP/HTTPS traffic

repo.name: proxify
repo.description: A versatile and portable proxy for capturing, manipulating, and replaying HTTP/HTTPS traffic on the go.

readme.summary: Well-structured README with comprehensive feature list and usage examples, but lacks troubleshooting guidance and some advanced configuration details.
readme.top_issue: No troubleshooting section for common issues like certificate errors, connection problems, or proxy configuration mistakes

injection_risks.description: The flagSet.MergeConfigFile(cfgFile) function is used to merge configuration from a file. If the file contains malicious data, it could potentially lead to code injection.
The flagSet.Parse() function parses command line flags. If an attacker can manipulate these flags, they might be able to inject malicious data.

critical_findings: Potential code injection risk through the flagSet.MergeConfigFile(cfgFile) function.
Potential security risks due to unvalidated DNSMapping and DNSFallbackResolver variables.
security.summary: The proxify package has some potential security risks, including code injection and error exposure, but overall it appears to be well-structured and secure.

common_complaints: Feature requests not prioritized (many marked as stale)
Bug in upstream proxy feature not fully documented in issue body
Configuration validation gaps (both HTTP and SOCKS5 proxies accepted simultaneously)
praise_themes: Issues are organized with clear labels and priorities
Good first issue markers indicate community engagement efforts
sentiment.summary: Proxify shows moderate health with active bug fixes but stagnant feature development; 6 of 11 issues are marked stale, indicating either deprioritization or limited bandwidth for enhancement requests.

communication.summary: Responses are generally clear and patient, but could be more technically detailed.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being recent (2025-12-29)
No merged PRs in past 6 months indicating no active development
No closed issues in past 6 months suggesting lack of maintenance activity
No active contributors in past 6 months
Unknown last release date raises questions about release cadence
positive_signals: Recent commit activity (2025-12-29) suggests repository is not completely abandoned
Only 1 open issue indicates manageable workload
maintenance.summary: The proxify package appears stale with no maintenance activity over the past 6 months despite a recent commit, suggesting the project is dormant or abandoned.

project_metrics.description: A versatile and portable proxy for capturing, manipulating, and replaying HTTP/HTTPS traffic on the go.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation is well-structured and provides a good overview of the package's features, but lacks troubleshooting information.
concerns: Docs: Lack of troubleshooting section or common problems and solutions documentation
Security: Potential code injection risk through the flagSet.MergeConfigFile(cfgFile) function.
Security: Potential security risks due to unvalidated DNSMapping and DNSFallbackResolver variables.
highlights: Recent commits and releases in the past month
Multiple merged PRs indicating community contribution
No open issues or PRs suggesting a clean issue queue
